oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Using Graph Transformation Systems to Specify and Verify Data Abstractions
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Baresi, Luciano
Ghezzi, Carlo
Mocci, Andrea
Monga, Mattia
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: ddc:004
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This paper proposes an approach for the specification of the behavior of software components that implement data abstractions. By generalizing the approach of behavior models using graph transformation, we provide a concise specification for data abstractions that describes the relationship between the internal state, represented in a canonical form, and the observers of the component. Graph transformation also supports the generation of behavior models that are amenable to verification. To this end, we provide a translation approach into an LTL model on which we can express useful properties that can be model-checked with a SAT solver.
